result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Denny A. Geddes

records.addlTxt:
8:44 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Denny A. Geddes appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Denny A. Geddes.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF81 and 22CF75 called. 

Attorney Erickson is heard.  Jury Trial in November will happen.
Jury status hearing on October 27, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Jury selection on November 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on November 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:03 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Denny A. Geddes appeared by phone.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by phone for Denny A. Geddes.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Erickson is heard on the status of the cases. No resolution. Requests trial for 21CF81. 
11:10 AM Attorney Steiner calls analyst to schedule a date. 
Deputy not available in October.  
Attorney Steiner will need to call analyst to see about a November date. 
Court suggests we put on for another JSH.
State is heard and analyst avail Nov 22, 23, and Dec 21,22
Jury trial scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury selection scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Jury status hearing on September 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:14AM Cases 21CF81, 22CF75 & 21TR797 called together - appearances stated. 
Defendant Denny A. Geddes appeared by phone.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson by Atty. Charlotte Wynes appeared by video for Denny A. Geddes.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty. Wynes is heard on status - requests Sept. status date
Jury status hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:45 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Denny A. Geddes appeared by phone.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Denny A. Geddes.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Information has been filed. 

Atty Erickson is heard and defendant waives further formal reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each of the 8 counts. 

21CF81 and 21TR797 off the calendar for June 30th and on the calendar for July 28th at 11 am via zoom.
Jury status hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury status hearing on July 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:16 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Denny A. Geddes appeared by telephone.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Denny A. Geddes.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

1W - JOSEPH BREESER - Sworn by Court
exam. by Atty. Steiner
cross exam by Atty. Erickson

Atty. Steiner moves for bind over
Atty. Erickson waives any argument, objects to bindover

Court finds probable cause and binds over for further proceedings.
Arraignment scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random PBTs and urinalysis at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with DG or SS. Defendant shall have no contact with his nine year old son.

1:30 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Denny A. Geddes appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Denny A. Geddes.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Initial appearance and bond modification. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count. Defendant states understanding.   

Defendant is heard. 

Atty Erickson is heard. Requests modifying bond. Requests a signature bond. Requests to change the no contact order with son. 
Atty Steiner is heard. State opposes any bond modification. 
Court sets bond at a $500.00 cash bond. Non monetary conditions will remain the same.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 25, 2022 at 11:15 am.

1:28 PM Call to Order by Court. Appearances stated: Defendant Denny A. Geddes appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause.  

State is heard on bond.  State requests a $1,500.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random PBTs and urinalysis at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with DG or SS. Defendant shall have no contact with his nine year old son. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $1,000.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random PBTs and urinalysis at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with DG or SS. Defendant shall have no contact with his nine year old son. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random PBTs and urinalysis at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with DG or SS. Defendant shall have no contact with his nine year old son.
